org.vaadin.appfoundation.persistence.facade
Class JPAFacade

java.lang.Object
  org.vaadin.appfoundation.persistence.facade.JPAFacade
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, IFacade
public class JPAFacade
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFacade, java.io.Serializable

An implementation of the IFacade interface. This class acts as a layer between the application logic and the database. This class's responsibilities are to connect to the database and manage the objects which are stored to or deleted/fetched from the database.

Author:
Kim
See Also:

Constructor Detail

JPAFacade

public JPAFacade()
Default constructor which does nothing. Make sure to call init() if you've used this constructor.

JPAFacade

public JPAFacade(java.lang.String name)
Alternative constructor. Takes as input the persistence-unit name and creates and entity manager factory based on that name.

Parameters:
name - Persistence-unit name (defined in the persistence.xml)

refresh

public <A extends AbstractPojo> void refresh(A pojo)
Update all the fields in the entity to the most up-to-date version of data found in the database. Any changes made to the entity object before calling this method will be overwritten.

Specified by:
refresh in interface IFacade
Parameters:
pojo - The entity object you wish to refresh

count

Gives the total number of records for the given entity type.

Specified by:
count in interface IFacade
Parameters:
c - Class object of the entity
Returns:
Total number of records or -1 if an exception occurred.

count

public java.lang.Long count(java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractPojo> c,
                            java.lang.String whereClause,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
Gives the total number of records for the given entity type which fulfills the where clause.

Specified by:
count in interface IFacade
Parameters:
c - Class object of the entity
whereClause - The query's WHERE clause with desired restraints.
parameters - A map of parameters and parameter values used in the query
Returns:
Total number of records or -1 if an exception occurred.
